No shit, bronze to gold in 20 games is almost impossible because of sheer fucking math.  assuming constant wins and 20 lp a game you would get silver 4 in 7, 3 in 14, and end up silver 3 one win from winning promos.   You need to play around 100 games or more to be placed in the proper rank.

However imo if people are still stuck in bronze/silver after a 100-150 games then they aren't improving they are just playing. To actively improve requires not only the drive to improve but the ability to recognize ones mistakes and activley try and fix them the next game.

Things like remembering enemy summoner times, roughly judging where the enemy jungle is, wave control, zone control, rotations, champion matchups, good ward placements and locations, good cs etc. All these things need to be researched out of the game through guides, videos and having someone explain it and then thought about in game. Not everything at once, but one at a time until they are all mastered.

If after a game people are just thinking "yeah yeah, I lost, I probably need to ward some more in lane so I die less to ganks" but don't do it next game they can play 1000 games and still be stuck in bronze/silver
